channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Ashleigh McMillan
item.description: A 36-year-old man has now been charged with murder over the shooting on July 4.
item.title: Man charged with murder over Corio shooting death

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: Friday was a grim day for Victoria with seven more deaths reported. It brought the number of COVID-19 victims of the state’s pandemic to 56, surpassing NSW where 49 lives have been lost.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victorian cases expected to rise further as Supreme Court rules on Sydney Black Lives Matter protest; Australian death toll stands at 140

item.dc:creator: Farrah Tomazin
item.description: Donald Trump has admitted that he was “devastated” when he won the US presidency because it marked an end to his "great" life.
item.title: 'I was devastated': Trump reflects on becoming President

item.description: One of the world’s fastest growing medical conditions, chronic pain affects one in five Australians and can strike anyone regardless of age, background or education.
item.title: Some days you accept it, some days you go, ‘Why me?’

item.dc:creator: Jo Stanley
item.description: It can be deeply irritating, but I choose to see my daughter's irrepressible joy. What a glorious expression of gratitude for legs, arms, breath and this moment.
item.title: The lesson my 11-year-old daughter taught me while home learning

item.dc:creator: Phil Lutton
item.description: Branded a traitor and facing seemingly insurmountable odds at a forgotten Games, Michelle Ford beat the might of the East German doping machine. Only now can she see her victory for what it was: extraordinary.
item.title: 'There are scars:' How Michelle Ford overcame death threats and dopers at Moscow Olympics

item.description: The interior designer also shares her three essential items and favourite feminine fragrance.
item.title: Why Tamsin Johnson is all for ball gowns at dinner parties

item.description: The study's findings indicate recovery can be prolonged even in young adults without chronic medical conditions.
item.title: Young, healthy adults with mild COVID-19 take weeks to recover: study

item.description: The court in London was shown video footage that Johnny Depp's lawyers claim shows that his ex-wife, Amber Heard, "attacked" her sister.
item.title: Depp's lawyers play video 'showing Heard attacked her sister'

item.description: The US President said "it was pretty, pretty pathetic" that Portland Mayor Ted Wheeler was tear-gassed as he joined protesters in his city.
item.title: 'A fool': Trump derides Portland mayor for getting tear-gassed

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: Damien Hardwick has challenged his Tiger cubs to step up and lay the foundation for another charge at the flag in the second half of the season.
item.title: 'Our system held up': Hardwick bullish on flag defence despite loss

item.description: The NSW government should learn, too, from the systemic problems which have emerged in Victoria. Each part of our public health system must be under constant review.
item.title: NSW can strive to stop COVID-19 community transmission

item.dc:creator: Martin Boulton
item.description: Melbourne musician Adalita said she felt a weight had been lifted after she was given funds to complete her new album.
item.title: Victorian grants to help keep the music playing

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: Graeme Samuel has warned that Australia’s “current environmental trajectory is unsustainable”. But the Morrison government's answer has raised new fears.
item.title: 'No integrity': Why states can't be left holding the environment file

item.dc:creator: John Silvester
item.description: I spent a little time out at the Croydon unit a year or so ago and some of their cases would have ended in murder without police intervention.
item.title: The scandal behind locked doors

item.dc:creator: Kate McClymont
item.description: "I have a cunning plan," businessman Mark Bryers told construction industry figure George Alex, according to surveillance of the alleged plan of a major tax fraud.
item.title: Smart Alex and the not-so-cunning plan: inside the alleged $17m tax fraud

item.dc:creator: Jessica Irvine
item.description: Compulsory mask-wearing, partial and full lockdowns: all options are on the table as NSW records more COVID-cases.
item.title: Lives versus livelihoods: the impossible calculus of a Lockdown 2.0

item.dc:creator: Carrie Fellner
item.description: It comes as council has been accused of burying building waste discovered under a home that once belonged to Eddie Obeid.
item.title: 'The beach is riddled with asbestos': erosion unearths toxic legacy at Wamberal

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Australia and the United States are set to launch a joint effort to counter disinformation coming from countries like China and Russia.
item.title: US and Australia set to launch campaign to counter disinformation

item.dc:creator: Tom Rabe
item.description: Attempting to recover from devastating bushfires and the first wave of coronavirus, the town of Batemans Bay has been thrust back into lockdown.
item.title: 'A nightmare': Batemans Bay thrust back into coronavirus lockdown

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: The NRL have been forced to put a market value on the dual international superstar as the Roosters inch closer to securing his return to Bondi.
item.title: NRL set to put $400,000-a-year price tag on SBW's Roosters deal

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: Psychiatrist says calls for help from Queensland’s junior doctors showing signs of burnout have spiked as the COVID-19 pandemic continues.
item.title: 'They are red-lining the engine': COVID's dangerous toll on young doctors

item.dc:creator: Peter Hartcher
item.description: The Morrison government’s economic response to the pandemic so far has been solid. But it's showing signs of mishandling the next stage.
item.title: Hesitant and dithering: The void at the heart of the government endangers the nation's future

item.dc:creator: Megan Gorrey
item.description: Three "small-scale controlled blasts" will go off beneath a residential street in Sydney's inner west, as work forges ahead on the underground M4-M5 Link.
item.title: Residents blow up over WestConnex plan to blast rocks beneath homes

item.description: The fact that Kardashian continues to speak of her husband with love and respect after the abortion revelation alone has raised my respect for her to no end.
item.title: My heart goes out to Kim Kardashian. Sincerely

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Saturday, July 25

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Knight
item.description: Pascal Soriot, the rock star CEO of UK pharma giant AstraZeneca, is joining the board of CSL as both companies race to unlock a COVID-19 vaccine.
item.title: COVID conflict or corporate coup: CSL welcomes AstraZeneca boss on board

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: The weakness in the Australian economy comes when old allies are suffering even greater declines this calendar year.
item.title: Morrison has outrun the avalanche but crisis remains

item.description: As with Australia's successful approach to HIV, we need the many people affected to have a stake in how we can best live with a virus that is not going away.
item.title: COVID, the wicked problem too big for medical experts alone to tackle

item.description: Electric cars and green energy are the first steps to revitalising the economy through job creation.
item.title: Now is our time to retool and diversify manufacturing

item.dc:creator: Tom Switzer
item.description: History tells us what we must do after the virus has done its worst: release the economy's "animal spirits" and let the free market return us to prosperity.
item.title: Dead hand of the state will be our JobKiller if it persists beyond the pandemic

item.dc:creator: Julia Baird
item.description: When a high-profile case of domestic abuse is dragged through the tabloids, those working to protect victims of abuse worry.
item.title: Exercise extreme caution when celebrity abuse cases end up in the media

item.dc:creator: Nicole Lindsay
item.description: Global burger flippers McDonald’s has reached a new milestone in its 50 years in Australia - its 1000th restaurant.
item.title: Maccas launches flagship sustainable store in Melton

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: Melbourne’s large pipeline of infrastructure projects is adding to demand from e-commerce for warehouses.
item.title: Cranes and equipment drive industrial leasing demand

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: The NSW Environment Minister has broken ranks with his federal Coalition counterpart Sussan Ley and backed the creation of an independent regulator to oversee compliance with national environmental laws.
item.title: Federal government should back a 'green cop', NSW's Matt Kean says

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Neighbourhood malls and suburban shopping strips are emerging as the most sought-after retail assets in the commercial sector as consumers opt to stay closer to home.
item.title: Neighbourhood malls flourish as shoppers stay local

item.dc:creator: Colin Kruger
item.description: Listed sports technology outfit Catapult has avoided becoming a casualty of the COVID-19 pandemic and is ready to tackle the 'new normal' for professional sports.
item.title: Australian sports tech firm Catapults over virus

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: Businesses big and small now face an uncertain future as support measures begin to fall away and lenders start having "hard conversations" with struggling clients.
item.title: Surrender or survive: Businesses face their biggest test yet as stimulus fades

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Mirvac and its consortium partners have boosted the high-technology component of an inner-city complex with a new lease.
item.title: Mirvac seals lease for high-tech government tenant

item.description: At one stage it was touch and go for the future of the Broadmeadows Town Hall or ‘Pink Elephant’ as it was known by locals.
item.title: 'Posh' town hall that hosted AC/DC gets new lease on life

item.dc:creator: Andrew Hornery
item.description: Dannii Minogue and Nicole Kidman were granted exemptions, but spare a thought for Anthony LaPaglia and Jane Seymour.
item.title: Hotel quarantine exposes celebrity pecking order

item.description: Demands and expectations for peace and quiet in residential areas during the day will increase.
item.title: Working from home will require a rethink of noise restrictions

item.dc:creator: Robert Moran
item.description: Audible and Spotify are bringing big names to the fiction podcast space.
item.title: Streaming giants tap into the return of the radio play

item.description: Dannii Minogue and Nicole Kidman were granted exemptions, but spare a thought for Anthony LaPaglia and Jane Seymour.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Hotel quarantine exposes celebrity pecking order

item.dc:creator: Benjamin Preiss
item.description: Bass Coast Shire wants to create a $4.5m dinosaur-themed walking track to promote it's fossil-rich history and help bolster the region’s recovery from pandemic.
item.title: Shire plans dinosaur trail to claw back tourists lost to fires, virus

item.dc:creator: Jewel Topsfield
item.description: Spiro Vasilakis says staff at St Basil's, home to the state's worst aged care outbreak of COVID-19, failed wear protective gear on a recent visit.
item.title: Son faults St Basil's over failure to protect his mother from COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Royce Millar
item.description: Large builder the Dennis Family Corporation is among a number of landowners planning to sue the government after properties it owned were included in a proposed reserve
item.title: State faces hundreds of millions in compensation over neglected grassland reserve

item.dc:creator: Richard Baker
item.description: A guard working for a subcontractor to Unified Security says staff were paid as little as $18, given no training and were forced to sign confidentiality agreements.
item.title: Hotel quarantine security done on the cheap via subcontractors, says guard

item.dc:creator: Aisha Dow
item.description: For almost two weeks, Marijane and Ireneo Dantic have been living with COVID-19. They're among the hundreds of families managing with the virus at home.
item.title: When coronavirus comes to stay, 'it’s like a dark cloud'

item.dc:creator: Kerrie O'Brien
item.description: Galleries are acquiring works related to the pandemic, including a knitted jumper with a picture of a runner and a kebab.
item.title: Ai Weiwei masks flip the bird, a kebab knit and gorgons: corona art
